title.rendered: 50% Discount on Traffic Fines in Four Emirates

content.rendered:
In connection with the Golden Jubilee of the United Arab Emirates, four emirates – Sharjah, Ajman, Umm Al Quiwan, and Fujairah – have announced a 50% discount on pending traffic fines.

However, there are certain restrictions on which traffic fines are covered.

For instance, the traffic violation in Sharjah must have been registered before November 21. In Ajman, the discount is applicable only to traffic violations that were registered before November 14. For Umm Al Quiwan, the traffic violation must have been registered before October 31 in order to be eligible for the discount announced. Traffic violations in Fujairah that were registered prior to November 25 are also eligible for the 50% discount.

Serious traffic violations are also not covered under the scheme. In Sharjah, serious traffic violations that are not eligible for the discount include jumping the red light and reckless driving that endangers the lives of road users. Ajman does not offer a discount for serious traffic violations that include reckless driving that endangers the lives of road users and modifying a vehicle’s engine without a permit.

Umm Al Quiwan does not offer any discount for serious traffic violations that includes reckless driving that endangers the lives of road users, modifying a vehicle’s engine without a permit, and COVID-19 safety violations. Fujairah does not offer any discount for serious traffic violations that include jumping the red light, reckless driving that endangers the lives of road users, and modifying a vehicle’s engine without a permit.

 

Those in Sharjah can pay the discounted fine(s) between 21 November 2021 and 31 January 2022. In Ajman, those eligible for the discount can make the payment between 21 November 2021 and 31 December 2021. In Umm Al Quiwan, the discounted traffic fine can be paid between 1 December 2021 and 6 January 2022. In Fujairah, the discount is valid for a period of 50 days beginning from 28 November 2021.

All traffic fines can be paid online, unless you have been specifically instructed to visit the Traffic Department in person. If you would like to know if any traffic fines are pending against your vehicle [you may have unknowingly committed a traffic offence and you may have missed the SMS/email notifying you of the offence], please click on the TAMM Traffic Fine Payment website.

If you have applied for a visa to Dubai, you can check the current status of your visa application by clicking on the Application Status Tracking portal.

 

 

This takes you to the website of the Ministry of the Interior, where you will be required to provide your vehicle licence plate number and the Traffic Code number on your vehicle’s registration card to find out if any traffic fines are pending against you or your vehicle.

A&A Associate LLC is a provider of legal services and business setup in Dubai. It has offices throughout the United Arab Emirates to serve its clients better. To date, it has been of assistance to clients from 100 countries around the world and has an excellent client satisfaction rate to speak of so far. For more details, please call +971 56 408 6728 or send us an enquiry using the form below.
